<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 5"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Thunder Helm](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1593)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Outlaws of Alkenstar</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #179: Cradle of Quartz](/Sources.aspx?ID=122) pg. 78

**Price** 160 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn headwear

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

The creator of the original _thunder helm_ tried and failed time and again to craft a reliable, helmet-mounted firearm that enabled hands-free gunplay, but even after resorting to magical enhancements, they were never quite able to realize their vision. The allure of the _thunder helm_ continues to compel certain mindsets in the Mana Wastes, and these items continue to be crafted to this day.

 A _thunder helm_ appears as a cylindrical iron helmet adorned with a crown-like display of gun barrels extending out in all directions. A slit in the front allows for limited visibility, while sound is muffled by the inner lining. As long as a creature wears a _thunder helm_, it takes a –1 circumstance penalty to [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16) and [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163) Perception checks but also gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against auditory and visual effects.

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> envision, Interact;  **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** The helm's gun barrels swivel and aim randomly, then conjure enough gunpowder and bullets to fire in all directions around you. Every creature within a 20-foot emanation takes 4d6 piercing damage (DC 19 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). When determining a creature's resistance or immunity to this damage, use the weaker of the target's resistance or immunity to piercing or bludgeoning.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
